content: this sweet blanket is a great project for newer crocheters who have mastered the humble granny square and are after something new the pattern includes both written and charted instructions as well as some tips for sewing your hexi s together it also comes in 3 suggested sizes from a baby blanket all the way to a large throw for your sofa but it is easy to make it as big or small as you like choose rainbow colours soft pastels or use up all of those 8ply leftovers - i encourage you to let your creativity fly with colours **sizes ** baby lap throw **dimesions ** 63cm x 77cm 91cm x 119cm 126cm x 147cm **yarn ** fibra natura cottonwood 105m/50g or any 8ply/dk weight yarn the colours we used in cottonwood are col a 41106 vivian col b 41107 monica col c 41101 cream col d 41102 beige col e 41144 mustard we used 5 colours but you can use as many as you like **quantity ** **col a** 2 balls 200m/218yd 4 balls 420m/460yd 8 balls 775m/848yd **col b** 2 balls 200m/218yd 4 balls 420m/460yd 8 balls 770m/842yd **col c** 1 ball 105m/115yd 3 balls 275m/300yd 4 balls 420m/460yd **col d** 1 ball 105m/115yd 3 balls 275m/300yd 4 balls 420m/460yd **col e** 1 ball 105m/115yd 3 balls 275m/300yd 4 balls 420m/460yd **or total ** 340g / 715m / 781yd 790g / 1665m / 1820yd 1325g / 2805m / 3070yd **hook ** 3 50 - 4mm or size to obtain gauge **gauge ** each hexagon measures about 7 cm from side to side and weighs approximately 3 6g **materials ** yarn needle for weaving in ends and joining **note ** this pattern is written using uk crochet terminology
